text:
Problem is in the authenticate method in JDBCRealms.java.
The username passed in can sometimes be null (possibly 
another bug?). When it is null, the connection to the DB
will be closed and later re-opened. This happens frequently
resulting in continuous openings/closings of the DB
connection (which are expensive operations in InstantDB).
It also seems to create some kind of a race condition
because authentication fails most of the time (maybe
works 1 out of every 4-5 attempts).
A simple fix is to add the following code to the beginning
of authenticate:
                if (username == null) {
	           return false;
	        }
